criteria: Security review of logging (PHI redaction) and database encryption (pgcrypto) passed. Architectural review of solution structure and DI setup passed. No hardcoded secrets in codebase.
success_metrics: Zero critical security vulnerabilities; All foundational ACs met.

criteria: All authentication scenarios (success, failure, disabled) pass E2E testing. RBAC rules correctly applied for both Admin and Technician roles across the UI. Security review of authentication logic passed.
success_metrics: 100% of authentication and authorization ACs met.

criteria: Session lock/unlock feature is fully functional and preserves application state. All specified events are correctly recorded in the audit trail. Audit trail viewer is functional.
success_metrics: HIPAA compliance features (session lock, audit) are validated.

criteria: E2E DICOM ingestion from an external tool is successful. All user management CRUD operations are functional from the UI and correctly audited.
success_metrics: Core data input (DICOM) and management (Users) features are stable.

criteria: DICOM viewer meets performance targets for image loading and manipulation. No GPU memory leaks are detected in a 30-minute test session. All core viewer tools are functional.
success_metrics: The core clinical feature of the application is usable and performant.

criteria: E2E password reset and forced change workflow is successful. PACS configuration UI is fully functional, including C-ECHO verification.
success_metrics: All administrative features for user lifecycle and system configuration are complete.

criteria: E2E DICOM query/retrieve workflow is successful against a test PACS. E2E asynchronous printing is functional to a virtual printer.
success_metrics: Core workflows for data interoperability (Q/R) and output (Print) are complete.

criteria: MSIX installer successfully deploys the application and service on a clean VM. First-run wizard correctly configures the application. License validation logic is confirmed to work for all states.
success_metrics: The application is ready for release candidate deployment.
